metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5178 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow was found during UTF8 to Unicode string conversion within JavaScript with extremely large amounts of data. This vulnerability requires the use of a malicious or vulnerable legacy extension in order to occur. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird ESR < 52.8, Thunderbird < 52.8, and Firefox ESR < 52.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5178` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
